edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.scrapers.ucsb_curriculum

Class UCSBCurriculumSearch

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.ucsb.cs56.projects.scrapers.ucsb_curriculum.UCSBCurriculumSearch

  • public class UCSBCurriculumSearch
extends Object
    This object is designed to parse input from the Curriculum Search page at: http://my.sa.ucsb.edu/public/curriculum/coursesearch.aspx Getting information from this site is especially challenging because of the ASPX viewstate issue; the viewstate must be preserved from transaction to transaction.
    Version:
    W14, extended from Matis ticket 396, W12, CS56
    Author:
    Phill Conrad, James Neally, Mark Nguyen, Daniel Vicory, Kevin Mai

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      UCSBCurriculumSearch()
      Constructor---called to initialize the UCSBCurriculumSearch object The default constructor initially makes an empty list of lectures, and initializes the viewstate for doing searches---but does not actually load up any courses.

    • Constructor Detail

      • UCSBCurriculumSearch

        public UCSBCurriculumSearch()
                     throws IOException
        Constructor---called to initialize the UCSBCurriculumSearch object The default constructor initially makes an empty list of lectures, and initializes the viewstate for doing searches---but does not actually load up any courses.
        Throws:
        IOException - thrown when an error occurs with input and output

    • Method Detail

      • getMainPage

        public static String getMainPage()
        getMainPage() returns the contents of the main page at MAINPAGE_URL as a String. This is primarily used internally to initialize the viewstate (needed for screenscraping ASPX websites).
        Returns:
        HTML code for the page

      • extractHiddenFieldValue

        public static String extractHiddenFieldValue(String name,
                                             String page)
        extractHiddenFielddValue is used to extract the __VIEWSTATE and the __EVENTVALIDATION values from the HTML for an ASPX web page.
        Parameters:
        name - name of the hidden field (e.g. "__VIEWSTATE" or "__EVENTVALIDATION")
        page - HTML for the page (e.g. result of getMainPage())
        Returns:
        value of the value attribute of that hidden field

      • encodedNameValuePair

        public static String encodedNameValuePair(String name,
                                          String value)
                                   throws Exception
        When searching for courses, the HTTP POST method must be used---this method helps to encode the HTML Form parameters properly (using URLEncoding)
        Parameters:
        name - name of the HTML input parameters
        value - value of the HTML input parameter
        Returns:
        string that should be appended to the characters to be sent in the payload of the HTML request. The & characters are not included.
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown when an error occurs

      • loadCourses

        public int loadCourses(String dept,
                       String qtr,
                       String level)
                throws Exception
        loadCourses is used to load up the UCSBCurriculumSearch object with a set of courses for a given Department, Quarter, and level. After courses are loaded into the object, other methods can be used to look up courses by course number and/or enrollment code
        Parameters:
        dept - department code. (e.g., "CMPSC" or "ART")
        qtr - 5 character quarter code (yyyyq where q=1,2,3,4 for Winter,Spring,Summer,Fall)
        level - one of "Undergraduate","Graduate","All"
        Returns:
        the number of courses loaded
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown when an error occurs

      • parseLectureHtml

        public UCSBLecture parseLectureHtml(String html)
        Parses the HTML of a Lecture and returns a new UCSBLecture object
        Parameters:
        html - HTML of a lecture.
        Returns:
        UCSBLecture object with added members

      • parseSectionHtml

        public UCSBSection parseSectionHtml(String html,
                                    UCSBLecture parent)
        Parses the HTML of a Section and returns a new UCSBSection object
        Parameters:
        html - HTML of section
        parent - UCSBLecture object that correlates to the section
        Returns:
        UCSBSection object with added members

      • getPage

        public String getPage(String dept,
                      String qtr,
                      String level)
               throws Exception
        getPage() returns the contents of a page of HTML containing the courses for a given department, quarter, and level. It is NOT a static method--it can only be invoked from an object, because it needs the instance variables for viewstate and event validation that were initialized in the constructor. This is primarily used internally to get the HTML that loadCourses parses to load courses into the object.
        Parameters:
        dept - department code. (e.g., "CMPSC" or "ART")
        qtr - 5 character quarter code (yyyyq where q=1,2,3,4 for Winter,Spring,Summer,Fall)
        level - one of "Undergraduate","Graduate","All"
        Returns:
        HTML code for the page
        Throws:
        Exception - thrown when an error occurs

      • getSection

        public UCSBSection getSection(String enrollCode)
        return a UCSBSection object given an enrollcode, if it doesn't exist, return a null object
        Parameters:
        enrollCode - string of an enrollment code
        Returns:
        UCSBSection section object correlating to the right enrollment code

      • getLecture

        public UCSBLecture getLecture(String Title,
                              String quarter)
        return a UCSBLecture object given a course number and quarter
        Parameters:
        Title - 13 character course num ddddddddnnnxx where dddddddd is the department, extended with spaces if needed, nnn is the course number, right justified, and xx is the extension if any. Examples: "CMPSC 5JA", "CMPSC 130A ","MATH 3C "
        quarter - quarter in yyyyQ format, where Q is 1,2,3,4 (1=W, 2=S, 3=M, 4=F)]
        Returns:
        a UCSBLecture object for that courseNum. If there are multiple instances, only the first one is returned. (Use getLectures() to get an ArrayList, and countLectures to determine how many there are.)

      • getLectures

        public ArrayList<UCSBLecture> getLectures(String courseNum,
                                          String quarter)
        return an ArrayList of UCSBLecture objects given a course number and quarter
        Parameters:
        courseNum - 13 character course num ddddddddnnnxx where dddddddd is the department, extended with spaces if needed, nnn is the course number, right justified, and xx is the extension if any. Examples: "CMPSC 5JA", "CMPSC 130A ","MATH 3C "
        quarter - quarter in yyyyQ format, where Q is 1,2,3,4 (1=W, 2=S, 3=M, 4=F)]
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of UCSBLecture objects for that courseNum. If there are none, an empty ArrayList is returned.

      • countLectures

        public int countLectures(String courseNum,
                         String quarter)
        return the number of UCSBLecture objects already loaded that match the given course number and quarter
        Parameters:
        courseNum - 13 character course num ddddddddnnnxx where dddddddd is the department, extended with spaces if needed, nnn is the course number, right justified, and xx is the extension if any. Examples: "CMPSC 5JA", "CMPSC 130A ","MATH 3C "
        quarter - quarter in yyyyQ format, where Q is 1,2,3,4 (1=W, 2=S, 3=M, 4=F)]
        Returns:
        how many instances there are of that lecture

      • getSection

        public UCSBSection getSection(String courseNum,
                              String quarter)
        return a UCSBSection object given a course number and quarter
        Parameters:
        courseNum - 13 character course num ddddddddnnnxx where dddddddd is the department, extended with spaces if needed, nnn is the course number, right justified, and xx is the extension if any. Examples: "CMPSC 5JA", "CMPSC 130A ","MATH 3C "
        quarter - quarter in yyyyQ format, where Q is 1,2,3,4 (1=W, 2=S, 3=M, 4=F)]
        Returns:
        a UCSBSection object for that courseNum. If there are multiple instances, only the first one is returned. (Use getSections() to get an ArrayList, and countSections to determine how many there are.)

      • getSections

        public ArrayList<UCSBSection> getSections(String courseNum,
                                          String quarter)
        return an ArrayList of UCSBSection objects given a course number and quarter
        Parameters:
        courseNum - 13 character course num ddddddddnnnxx where dddddddd is the department, extended with spaces if needed, nnn is the course number, right justified, and xx is the extension if any. Examples: "CMPSC 5JA", "CMPSC 130A ","MATH 3C "
        quarter - quarter in yyyyQ format, where Q is 1,2,3,4 (1=W, 2=S, 3=M, 4=F)]
        Returns:
        an ArrayList of UCSBSection objects for that courseNum (possibly spanning multiple lectures sections). If there are none, an empty ArrayList is returned.

      • countSections

        public int countSections(String courseNum,
                         String quarter)
        return the number of UCSBSection objects already loaded that match the given course number and quarter
        Parameters:
        courseNum - 13 character course num ddddddddnnnxx where dddddddd is the department, extended with spaces if needed, nnn is the course number, right justified, and xx is the extension if any. Examples: "CMPSC 5JA", "CMPSC 130A ","MATH 3C "
        quarter - quarter in yyyyQ format, where Q is 1,2,3,4 (1=W, 2=S, 3=M, 4=F)]
        Returns:
        how many sections there are for that course (possibly across multiple lectures)

      • printLectures

        public void printLectures()
        Prints lectures and subsquent section

      • main

        public static void main(String[] args)
        main method to demonstrate that the page is being accessed
        Parameters:
        args - String arguments in the order of: Department (CMPSC), quarter (Spring), year (2014), and level (Undergraduate)

      • qtrParse

        public static String qtrParse(String qtr)
        Parses the quarter to the correct corresponding number that represents it.
        Parameters:
        qtr - string of the quarter e.g Summer, Winter, Fall, Spring
        Returns:
        String quarter number (Winter - 1, Spring - 2, Summer - 3, Fall - 4)
